00045 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 //
00047 // CLASS: uvm_component
00048 //
00049 // Base class for structural UVM elements.
00050 // Derives from sc_module, and provides name, and hierarchy information.
00051 //
00052 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00061 class uvm_component;
00062 typedef uvm_component *puvm_component;

00064 class uvm_component : public sc_core::sc_module, public uvm_typed {
00065 public:
00066   friend class uvm_manager;

00075   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076   // get_type_name   -- Required override
00077   //
00078   // Return the type name of this class - e.g., "my_component".
00079   // Inherits this pure virtual method from base class uvm_typed.
00080   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 
00082   virtual std::string get_type_name() const = 0;

00096   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097   // Set up configuration.
00098   //
00099   // The configuration settings will be stored in a table inside
00100   // this component.
00101   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00102 
00103   template <typename T> void set_config_int(
00104     const std::string& instname,
00105     const std::string& field,
00106     const T& val
00107   );
00108   void set_config_string(
00109     const std::string& instname,
00110     const std::string& field,
00111     const std::string& val
00112   );
00113   void set_config_object(
00114     const std::string& instname,
00115     const std::string& field,
00116     uvm_object* val,
00117     bool clone = true
00118   );
00119 
00120   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121   // Get configurations.
00122   //
00123   // A get_config_xxx() call will look for a corresponding set_confiog_xxx()
00124   // call. The search will be done starting from the global configuration
00125   // table, and continuing in each component's configuration table in 
00126   // the parent hierarchy, in a top-down order.
00127   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128 
00129   template <class T> bool get_config_int(
00130     const std::string& field,
00131     T& val
00132   );
00133   bool get_config_string(
00134     const std::string& field,
00135     std::string& val
00136   );
00137   bool uvm_get_config_string(
00138     const std::string& field,
00139     std::string& val
00140   );
00141   bool get_config_object(
00142     const std::string& field,
00143     uvm_object*& val,
00144     bool clone = true
00145   );

00174   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00175   // Pre-run phase - build().
00176   //
00177   // build() is an alias for the existing sc_module phase
00178   // before_end_of_elaboration().
00179   // Other pre-run phases are inherited from sc_module.
00180   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00181 
00182   virtual void end_of_construction(); 
00183   virtual void build(); // synonym for before_end_of_elaboration;
00184   virtual void build_phase(uvm_phase *phase = NULL);
00185   virtual void connect_phase(uvm_phase *phase = NULL);
00186   virtual void before_end_of_elaboration(); 
00187   virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00188   virtual void end_of_elaboration_phase(uvm_phase *phase = NULL);
00189   virtual void start_of_simulation();
00190   virtual void start_of_simulation_phase(uvm_phase *phase = NULL);
00191 
00192   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193   // Pre-run phase - connect()
00194   //
00195   // connect() is a UVM-SC specific phase
00196   // It does not exist in sc_module.
00197   // Other pre-run phases are inherited from sc_module.
00198   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00199 
00200   virtual void connect();
00201 
00202   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00203   // The run phase.
00204   //
00205   // The main thread of execution.
00206   // The component should not declare run as a thread process - it is
00207   // automatically spawned by uvm_component's constructor.
00208   // Run phase ends either by the uvm_stop_request() protocol
00209   // or by a timeout that can be customized by calling
00210   // uvm_set_global_timeout().
00211   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00212 
00213   virtual void run_phase(uvm_phase *phase); 
00214   virtual void run(); 
00215   virtual void reset_phase(uvm_phase *phase); 
00216   //virtual void reset();
00217   virtual void configure_phase(uvm_phase *phase); 
00218   virtual void configure();
00219   virtual void main_phase(uvm_phase *phase); 
00220   virtual void main();
00221   virtual void shutdown_phase(uvm_phase *phase); 
00222   virtual void shutdown();
00223 
00224   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00225   // Post-run phases.
00226   //
00227   // These phases will trigger after the run phase ends.
00228   // Usually after the post-run phases are over, sc_stop() is  
00229   // issued, which wll trigger the end_of_simulation() phase also. 
00230   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00231 
00232   virtual void extract_phase(uvm_phase *phase);
00233   virtual void extract();
00234   virtual void check_phase(uvm_phase *phase);
00235   virtual void check();
00236   virtual void report_phase(uvm_phase *phase);
00237   virtual void report();
00238   virtual void final_phase(uvm_phase *phase);
00239   virtual void final();
00240 
00241   virtual void phase_started(uvm_phase *phase);
00242   virtual void phase_ready_to_end(uvm_phase *phase);
00243   virtual void phase_ended(uvm_phase *phase);
00244 
00245   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00246   // Issue process control constructs on run() process.
00247   //
00248   // For those simulators that support process control constructs, 
00249   // the corresponding construct will be issued on the run() process
00250   // handle. A value of false is returned if a simulator does not
00251   // support process control constructs.
00252   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00253 
00254   virtual bool kill();
00255   virtual bool reset();
00256   virtual bool suspend();
00257   virtual bool resume();
00258   virtual bool disable();
00259   virtual bool enable();
00260   virtual bool sync_reset_on();
00261   virtual bool sync_reset_off();
00262   // cannot use virtual with templated member method
00263   template <typename T>
00264   //virtual bool throw_it(T& t);
00265   bool throw_it(T& t);
00266 
00267   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00268   // Objection interface
00269   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00270 
00271   // Function: raised
00272   //
00273   // The raised callback is called when a decendant of the component instance
00274   // raises the specfied ~objection~. The ~source_obj~ is the object which
00275   // originally raised the object. ~count~ is an optional count that was used
00276   // to indicate a number of objections which were raised.
00277 
00278   //virtual void raised (uvm_objection *objection, uvm_component *source_comp, int count) {};
00279 
00280 
00281   // Function: dropped
00282   //
00283   // The dropped callback is called when a decendant of the component instance
00284   // raises the specfied ~objection~. The ~source_obj~ is the object which
00285   // originally dropped the object. ~count~ is an optional count that was used
00286   // to indicate a number of objections which were dropped.
00287 
00288   //virtual void dropped (uvm_objection* objection, uvm_component* source_comp, int count) {};
00289 
00290 
00291   // Function: all_dropped
00292   //
00293   // The all_dropped callback is called when a decendant of the component instance
00294   // raises the specfied ~objection~. The ~source_obj~ is the object which
00295   // originally all_dropped the object. ~count~ is an optional count that was used
00296   // to indicate a number of objections which were dropped. This callback is
00297   // time-consuming and the all_dropped conditional will not be propagated
00298   // up to the object's parent until the callback returns.
00299 
00300   //virtual void all_dropped (uvm_objection* objection, uvm_component* source_comp, int count) {};
00301 
00302   void set_run_handle(sc_core::sc_process_handle h);
00303   void set_reset_handle(sc_core::sc_process_handle h);
00304   void set_configure_handle(sc_core::sc_process_handle h);
00305   void set_main_handle(sc_core::sc_process_handle h);
00306   void set_shutdown_handle(sc_core::sc_process_handle h);
00307 
00308   virtual void config_callback(std::string cntxt, std::string inst_name, std::string field_name, uvm_resource_base * rsrc);
00309   virtual void rsrc_callback(uvm_rsrc_action action, std::string inst_name, std::string field_name, uvm_resource_base * rsrc);
00310 
00311 
00312   virtual bool is_traversable() { return true; }
00313

00327 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00328 // Templated functions necessary to support get_config_int()
00329 //
00330 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00331 #define uvm_get_nbits_type(t) \
00332 inline unsigned int uvm_get_nbits(const t& v) { \
00333   return (8 * sizeof(v)); \
00334 }
00335 uvm_get_nbits_type(bool)
00336 uvm_get_nbits_type(char)
00337 uvm_get_nbits_type(sc_dt::uchar)
00338 uvm_get_nbits_type(short)
00339 uvm_get_nbits_type(ushort)
00340 uvm_get_nbits_type(int)
00341 uvm_get_nbits_type(uint)
00342 uvm_get_nbits_type(long)
00343 uvm_get_nbits_type(ulong)
00344 uvm_get_nbits_type(sc_dt::int64)
00345 uvm_get_nbits_type(sc_dt::uint64)
00346 
00347 inline unsigned int uvm_get_nbits(const sc_dt::sc_bv_base &v) {
00348   return v.length();
00349 }
00350 
00351 inline unsigned int uvm_get_nbits(const sc_dt::sc_logic &v) {
00352   return 1;
00353 }
00354 
00355 template <typename T> void uvm_convert_from_bv(T& v, sc_dt::sc_bv_base bv) {
00356   v = bv; 
00357 }
00358 inline void uvm_convert_from_bv(sc_dt::sc_logic& v, const sc_dt::sc_bv_base& bv) { \
00359   v = bv.get_bit(0);
00360 }
00361 #define uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(t) \
00362 inline void uvm_convert_from_bv(t& v, const sc_dt::sc_bv_base& bv) { \
00363   sc_dt::uint64 u = bv.to_uint64(); \
00364   v = u;  \
00365 }
00366 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(bool)
00367 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(char)
00368 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(sc_dt::uchar)
00369 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(short)
00370 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(ushort)
00371 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(int)
00372 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(uint)
00373 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(long)
00374 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(ulong)
00375 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(sc_dt::int64)
00376 uvm_convert_from_bv_int_type(sc_dt::uint64)
00377 // and similarly for char, unsigned, ...
00378 
00380 
00381 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00382 // Templated functions necessary to support set_config_int()
00383 //
00384 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00385 
00386 template <typename T> sc_dt::sc_bv_base uvm_convert_to_bv(const T& v) {
00387   int nbits = uvm_get_nbits(v);
00388   sc_dt::sc_bv_base bv(nbits);
00389   bv = v;
00390   return bv;
00391 }
00392 inline sc_dt::sc_bv_base uvm_convert_to_bv(const sc_dt::sc_logic& v) {
00393   sc_dt::sc_bv_base bv(1);
00394   bv.set_bit(0,v.value());
00395   return bv;
00396 }
00397 
00399 
00400 template <typename T> void uvm_component::set_config_int(
00401   const std::string& instname,
00402   const std::string& field,
00403   const T& val
00404 ) {
00405 
00406   int nbits = uvm_get_nbits(val);
00407   sc_dt::sc_bv_base bv(nbits);
00408 
00409   bv = uvm_convert_to_bv(val);
00410   uvm_config_db<sc_dt::sc_bv_base>::set(this, instname, field, bv);
00411 }
00412 
00413 template <typename T> bool uvm_component::get_config_int(
00414   const std::string& field,
00415   T& val
00416 ) {
00417   bool result;
00418   int nbits = uvm_get_nbits(val);
00419   sc_dt::sc_bv_base bv(nbits);
00420 
00421   result =  uvm_config_db<sc_dt::sc_bv_base >::get(this, "", field, bv);
00422   if (result)
00423     uvm_convert_from_bv(val, bv);
00424 
00425   return result;
00426 }

00430 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00431 // Registration macros to register an uvm_component with the factory.
00432 // 
00433 // A registration macro should be invoked outside the uvm_component class
00434 // declaration.
00435 // A registration macro registers the given uvm_component with the factory, and
00436 // defines the get_type_name() member method of the registered component.
00437 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00438 
00439 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00440 // Use the macro below to register a simple non-templated uvm_component.
00441 // The macro argument is the name of the class.
00442 // The registered name with the factory is the same as the macro argument.
00443 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00444 
00445 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER(t) \
00446 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##t = \
00447   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #t,new t::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00448 inline std::string t::get_type_name() const { return #t; }
00449 
00450 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00451 // Use the macro below to register a simple non-templated uvm_component,
00452 // with a different registered name (first argument) than its
00453 // class name (second argument).
00454 // The registered name with the factory is the same as the first macro argument.
00455 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00456 
00457 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_ALIAS(name,t) \
00458 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##name##_##t UVM_UNUSED_ATTR = \
00459   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #name,new t::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00460 inline std::string t::get_type_name() const { return #name; }
00461 
00462 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00463 // Use the macro below for registering templated uvm_components with
00464 // one template parameter.
00465 // The first macro argument is the class name, and the second macro argument
00466 // is a specific value of the template parameter.
00467 // Example usage: "UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T(mycomp, int)".
00468 // The registered name with the factory is a concatenation of the first
00469 // and second arguments, separated by "_".
00470 // e.g., "mycomp_int".
00471 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00472 
00473 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T(t,T) \
00474 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##t##_##T UVM_UNUSED_ATTR = \
00475   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #t "_" #T, new t<T>::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00476 template<> inline std::string t<T>::get_type_name() const { return #t "_" #T; }
00477 
00478 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00479 // Use the macro below for registering templated uvm_components with
00480 // one template parameter, when you do not want the default registered name.
00481 // Specify the alternate registration name as the first macro argument.
00482 // Example usage: "UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T_ALIAS(myname, mycomp, int)".
00483 // The registered name with the factory is the same as the first macro 
00484 // argument.
00485 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486 
00487 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T_ALIAS(name,t,T) \
00488 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##name##_##t UVM_UNUSED_ATTR = \
00489   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #name, new t<T>::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00490 template<> inline std::string t<T>::get_type_name() const { return #name; }
00491 
00492 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00493 // Use the macro below for registering templated uvm_components with
00494 // two template parameters.
00495 // The first macro argument is the class name. 
00496 // The second and third macro arguments are specific values of the
00497 // two template parameters.
00498 // Example usage: "UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T2(myothercomp, int, int)".
00499 // The registered name with the factory is a concatenation of the first,
00500 // second, and third arguments, separated by "_". 
00501 // e.g., "myothercomp_int_int".
00502 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00503 
00504 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T2(t,T1,T2) \
00505 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##t##_##T1##_##T2 UVM_UNUSED_ATTR = \
00506   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #t "_" #T1 "_" #T2, new t<T1,T2>::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00507 template<> inline std::string t<T1,T2>::get_type_name() const { return #t "_" #T1 "_" #T2; }
00508 
00509 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00510 // Use the macro below for registering templated uvm_components with 
00511 // two template parameters, when you do not want the default registered name.
00512 // Specify the alternate registration name as the first macro argument.
00513 // Example usage: 
00514 //   "UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T2_ALIAS(myname, myothercomp, int, int)".
00515 // The registered name with the factory is the same as the first macro argument.
00516 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00517 
00518 #define UVM_COMPONENT_REGISTER_T2_ALIAS(name,t,T1,T2) \
00519 static int uvm_component_register_dummy_##name##_##t UVM_UNUSED_ATTR = \
00520   uvm::uvm_factory::register_component_creator( #name, new t<T1,T2>::uvm_component_creator_##t()); \
00521 template<> inline std::string t<T1,T2>::get_type_name() const { return #name; }
00522 
00523 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00524 // Utility macro to instrument an uvm_component such that it can be registered
00525 // with the factory.
00526 // 
00527 // The utility macro should be invoked inside the uvm_component class
00528 // declaration.
00529 // The utility macro declares
00530 // - the uvm_component_creator_<classname> class used by the factory
00531 //   to create an instance of this component.
00532 // - the get_type_name() member method inside the uvm_component class.
00533 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00534 
00535 #define UVM_COMPONENT_UTILS(t) \
00536 class uvm_component_creator_##t : public uvm::uvm_component_creator { \
00537 public: \
00538   uvm::uvm_component* create(const std::string& name) { \
00539     uvm::uvm_component* _ncsc_comp = new t(name.c_str()); \
00540     return _ncsc_comp; \
00541   } \
00542 }; \
00543 virtual std::string get_type_name() const;
00544 
00546 
00547 } // namespace uvm
